And lo and behold, within less than 24 hours I get a refund - the refund confirmation comes in form of an answer showing all my messages to them, in which I ask them for the credentials. Obviously they are reading their messages - why would they choose not to answer my simple request and send me the promised login credentials after purchase? ---From product to customer service: nothing is great about FontBase.I did not receive customer support.The software is not intuitive to the point of being unpractical. As Figma is an essential tool for my design workflow, it is crucial for me to have seamless integration with FontBase to maintain consistency and productivity.I kindly request your assistance in resolving this matter. It would be greatly appreciated if you could provide guidance on any potential solutions or workarounds to enable FontBase fonts to function correctly within Figma. Additionally, if there are any known compatibility issues between FontBase and Figma, I would be grateful for any information or updates on this matter.Please let me know if you require any further information or if there is any additional troubleshooting I can attempt on my end to assist with the resolution process.Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your response and a swift resolution to the font compatibility issue between FontBase and Figma.Best regards,

I was trying to speed up the programs I need these fonts for by disabling the ones I don't need, but FontBase is just as slow to load, if not slower, than having all the fonts enabled at all times. And many times, fonts that I turned on in FontBase would not appear at all in Illustrator or InDesign, requiring several rounds of restarting those apps or deleting preference files. Since I stopped using FontBase, I've had zero problems loading these fonts.Being able to preview fonts and organize them is helpful when I'm trying to choose the right one for a project, but even using FontBase just for this purpose causes my entire system to lag. Overall, the few benefits this program has (font previewing, organization, free) aren't worth all the lost time in lag and performance.

Review.Titre: Overall I like FontBase but there are a…
Review.Contenu: Overall I like FontBase but there are a few issues...1. Font don't always activated on when loading documents in programs like Photoshop where they have been used - this is inconvenient as we have to open FB and toggle them on to get them to work.2. Watch Folder Issue - Google Drive:If your FontBase root folder is on your Google Drive (for working with teams to sync collections), you CAN NOT create Watch Folders. This means you can’t watch your System fonts, OR, if you have your fonts organized outside the FontBase root and want to “Watch” those folders for changes vs. making copies you can’t.The only workaround for this is to have FontBase installed locally, and then each team member can use a "Watched Folder" for Google Drive, however, then Collections are no longer shared/synced.It's a huge pain point for working with teams when using Google Drive. There's an entire thread on it in their Support Forms called "Google Drive - Watch Folders Issues"; unfortunately we can't add links in reviews.3. Lack of Sub-Folders for Collections make things a bit messy for organization. It's also problematic for Teams due to point #2.The UI is nice, the price is right, but there are some of those smaller grievances that have us looking to move back to Connect Fonts (formerly Suitcase Fusion)

As a graphic designer, font management is critical, especially as I have over 4000 fonts on my system. For years I struggled with the clumsiness of Font Book on my Mac, mostly because it was free. Then I stumbled onto FontBase, tried out the free version and loved it. I'm amazed at what is included for free. Although there were some features the paid version included that I felt would be useful, I mainly felt that a piece of software that is so well thought out, so well supported and also reasonably priced, deserved my hard earned dollars. I renewed my annual subscription for my second year now just the other day.While I really love the speed and minimal fuss approach the developers have taken with the UI, for me, the ability to 'Add' watched folders is the deal sealer. I have manually sorted my fonts into folders named by style categories on my iMac, which I sync to my cloud backup. These then become available when I sync my Macbook which has the same FontBase setup for when I work remotely. Any font I add into my watched folders immediately becomes available for activation in FontBase on both machines and easily locatable. Such a time saver.I'm sure it's possible this feature is available elsewhere, but I'd be surprised if it was done better and for free.I cannot recommend enough the work these guys are doing, if fonts are your thing.
